documents.document: Anyone remember that graph of the impact of change showing a negative first before raising up, with an arrow “most people stop here” ? #lazyweb
@BenedictEvans Don’t forget AirPods in that mix.
@sparrk “Never interrupt your enemy when he is making a mistake” - Napoleon
Apple rightly picked cartoonish fun over creepy uncanny valley almost but not quite realism. https://t.co/WfjCwUc4m4
@s144n3sh @mcpaccard Performance and google Amp. See @adactio.
@s1monvdk As tu pensé à l’étranger? Ici (🇬🇧) tu fais un master (equivalent M2) direct après une licence (equivalent bachelor). C’est ce que j’ai fait…
@JanSru @PhilipMorton But it break the “you don’t have to learn how to say it” aspect. It’s a pain across users for home use. What exact phrase did my wife use for train times again?
@JanSru @PhilipMorton … The new “make your own phrase” feels like a way to catch up / work around / complement that initial approach. Works really well w the idea of workflow combining multi apps...

@JanSru @PhilipMorton Siri was designed from the start not to require an exact phrase (unlike Alexa/google), but instead understand the many many ways people would use, across languages, that’s why they limited it to a few intents…

@LaurentVaissade @nitot @DuckDuckGo @Qwant_FR Merci Tristan de tes réponses. Main quand je lis : “The following results are probably not relevant, please rephrase your query.” Je me demande pourquoi vous montrez des résultats que vous savez ne pas être bons, et surtout… accuser l’utilisateur des défauts de son produit :/ https://t.co/0nDaKgK3Uz
🔥 https://t.co/A10z6t4Ljv
@lukew I thought the guy was peeing…

It’s a detail, but the way Apple had slides and videos specially adapted to the ultra wide format of the screen behind the speakers was awesome. So much better to watch remotely that the usual speaker / slide Picture in Picture. https://t.co/9rO2Gvxgwk

… The default block across all iOS user and macOS using safari will very quickly cut a core data source for facebook and other privacy invading trackers. THANK YOU! Websites, sorry, but you’ve had ages to figure out a non disgusting business model.

Delighted by the key #wwdc key thread: 🖕Facebook. 1) Better visibility and control of time spent in time-suck app. Demo’ed w Facebook (Instagram) apps. 2) Block by default of these disgusting “like” button that track you on every site without your knowledge of consent…
Getting home early for 🍎 Xmas. Aka #WWDC keynote.
@nitot Felicitations ! Premiere question: Pourquoi utiliser quant plutôt que @duckduckgo?
Just scribbled onto a post it then used photobooth to capture it before pasting in an email. There must be a better way…
@Folletto (Also LOL at my some earlier tweet that somehow got autocorrected in French)

@Folletto Slack isn’t meant to be just chat client, it’s a “Searchable Log of All Conversation and Knowledge” (SLACK). Info there isn’t ephemeral. Anything that isn’t a live call is async IMHO, the variation is just the average expected answer time.
@Folletto Nothing in Slack itself that makes it sync or async, both can work… but the expected v j’avoue need to be clear, things get ugly when one party expect sync and the other async…
@Ettore_Rizza @fabiantilmant J’aime beaucoup les graphs “ Change in councillors” de https://t.co/vmWNpOPuFX

@stroughtonsmith The (continuing) bounce was necessary to communicate that the app wasn’t stuck loading when HDD and slow CPU meant it could be ages before the app was actually running. Unnecessary now.
@WalterStephanie Gravissime vu les conséquences :-(

@davidallengreen @jwaterworth Except even brexiters knew that with 10 year to see how that is going, it was very unlikely the public would have supported it long enough. Only shot at Brexit is before the public understand its impact.

When you get to told to come earlier, move ⛰ to adapt childcare plans, add time for train delays just to be on time... And the meeting was actually planned to start much later to handle people unprofessional enough to be late 🤬

What lovely thing to want to improve 👍 True story: despite being the most straightforward of foreigners (EU citizens), most banks would refuse to open a simple current account for my wife and I. We went w @AskLloydsBank just for that. Still w them 10y later. https://t.co/tyzjJQBpH1
@PeteWilliams If you’re looking for a replacement, I use @TideBanking and it automatically sync w FreeAgent :)
Also I have seen many odd app strategy but downloading an app that only loads the website :-/ Even w the we lower expectations, this ordering process is so broken. https://t.co/lcj25Pe5By
Such a disgraceful and misleading message. As a thank you for your order, here is £7 of your next order… if you commit to pay us £15 per month from now on. #darkpattern https://t.co/BoLqLSVK8r
@ruskin147 @bmwelby Presumably that figure would have been the sell price and is orders of magnitude above what it actually cost them.

RT @sandofsky: The only way to protect a good idea is superior execution.
@Jeremy74 … especially odd as Macs have these 2 naming conventions: plain English “MacBook Pro (Retina, 13-inch, Early 2015)” and specific “MacBookPro12,1”

@Jeremy74 Good question. iPhone 8 is a family of devices (different storage, radios etc) so Settings mentions more precise Model ID. But for sure for most general public discussion “iPhone 7” would be more useful...
RT @cedricbozzi: I like “iPhone, iPhone X, iPhone X Plus” (i.e., numbers be gone) but I can’t understand a lineup that’s 5.8, 6.1 and 6.5.…

@sparrk @fehrtrade I wrote and heard back from @instapaper… no ETA but some intent. “We've already been working on GDPR stuff, have made progress, and are going to continue doing everything we can to get Instapaper available to you and the rest of our European users as soon as possible.“
Current UK unemployed count is 1,411,000. (ONS) No deal Brexit would TRIPLE that. Soft Brexit would “only” increase it by 50%. 🤯 Insanity at an unbelievable scale. 🤬 https://t.co/qICkA5qcRd
@wickedgeekie Slightly aggressive no?
@adrianh Same here! In Prattchet’s Discworld, there are trolls that are stupid usually, but then we find out in cold temperature they’re much smarter. I feel the same…
Fascinating thread, or how Queen Elizabeth choice of brooches is her main form of public expression. Love what she chose for trump’s visit. https://t.co/FFKv85C1yp
@WalterStephanie Same. Awful results, terrible confused and discouraged windows user feeling helpless :/ Tasing on Mac is fine, but need to ask/set scroll direction and disable these gestures.

@WalterStephanie Yeah. Trackpad scroll for other than scroll are asking for pain.
Try explaining to people confused by 2 bouton mice that the same gesture has different consequences if started from the edge of the trackpad or a couple millimetres inside it.
@markboulton I’d very much question there expertise in politics too, TBH.
@WalterStephanie As long as the main device to control scrolling on desktop is the one dimensional scroll wheel, H scroll will be a pain. Obviously not an issue with touch devices.
@belenpena Website do use analytics data to bill, but of course they bill advertiser, not consumers, and there is no cost to display an additional impression.
@belenpena Cut the wires, reconnect around. Electricity delivery is pretty low tech.

@belenpena I share the sentiment and do the same, but it’s not that clear cut. You could bypass your electricity meter and claim you still get power, but meters are essential for the sustainable delivery of the service.
I tend to think: first party analytics are fine, X site trackers no.

Been thinking for a while the USA is heading towards a second civil war, in many ways just continuing the first. Sounds crazy? Wait until the Muller investigation concludes w damning evidence, and Congress does nothing. And more realise elections were and will be rigged. https://t.co/lhQwb2IlZ4

@MikeAtherton Might be but do google it, feels like there are brokers for everything in this country. Car buying was still awful, with “I can’t give you that price I need to see w the manager” etc theatre.
@MikeAtherton There are car broker sites. They get dealership around te country to make you their best offer. Then you either buy from them, or use their quote to negotiate at your local dealership.

Some of that is due to curiosity, but some of it is simply age. I remember the time before the Web. It was different then, it can also be different in the future. https://t.co/8NkPQVSNh8

Understanding products of the past give you a superpower: knowing that all products are temporary. Once you get that you see nothing that currently stand will stay that way for long, and free your vision from thinking this is the way things are and must stay. #thisTooShallPass
